1.content:
Exploration was always your thing. Your curiosity knew no bounds. It didn’t matter whether that was clicking one more hyperlink on Wikipedia because you just had to find out what a halfpenny was, or if it meant breaking and entering to uncover secrets. You’d gotten yourself caught up in the latter.

Your friend, Tony, told you about this secret lab underneath the science department of the university. He didn’t have anything concrete but had heard rumours that that some weird stuff happened in there. Stuff that the scientists got paid to do but couldn’t tell the students about. You didn’t need much convincing after that.

A few nights later the pair of you met up. Tony had worked out the best way to get into the underground lab and you were just stoked, if a little nervous, to be involved. Getting in way easier than you thought. It should’ve been difficult. The doors leading to the lab used these weird digital locks that you’d never seen before but which only took Tony a few minutes and two tries to figure out. Did you know he’s a computer science student? And he uses what they teach him to break into his own uni.

After a few of these doors and a close call with a security guard, you get into the underground labs. Corridors and glassed rooms and desks and prototypes surround you on all sides. You’re overwhelmed. And then you screw up.

You knew not to do anything dumb. You’re better than that. But you went and touched something anyway. You didn’t even go in search of the cool-looking stuff like Tony did. The first thing you could get your hands on. It was this small cylindrical device inside one of the glassed rooms. You touched it, and then you couldn’t stop. It wouldn’t come off. You freaked out. You shook and shook and shook your hand. You caused a commotion. Tony came running back.

Eventually he helped you pry it off of you, but you could tell he was mad. No time to dwell. You can hear footsteps echoing in the corridors. You don’t know how many. You don’t know which ones. You need to go all the same. Urgency rises inside the pair of you and you run.

A few doors bypassed, a few guards dodged, one just barely, and you’re out. You’ve made it back to the front of the science department building. The commotion is too far underground for you to hear but you agree that it’s no reason for either of you to wait around. You say your goodbyes and that you’ll see each other tomorrow before parting ways.

As you walk back you can’t help but try to look at the spot on your hand whether the device latched on. It was hard to tell because of how dark it was outside, but it looked as there wasn’t any sign of anything happening. Weird, but it could just be that you can’t see it. It also might’ve not done anything. It probably did nothing.

You get back to your house and let yourself in. It’s not the biggest place, but it’ll do for how much you pay. Your housemate’s already gone to bed but has left evidence that they’ve been around. Leftover takeout on the kitchen table. You turn your nose up.

In the living room you find your dog, Jasper, sleeping beside the sofa.

“Someone’s living the life,” you say, smiling at him as you drop down on the sofa.

You stroke the top of Jasper’s head a couple of time before rolling your head back and resting your eyes for a moment. That moment gets weird though. You feel like you’re sinking more than you normally sink in the sofa. Then you feel like you’re rising. That’s weird. It’s really weird. Your eyes snap open and you’re not on the sofa anymore. You’re floating above it. You’re floating above... is that you?? You can see your body sat on the sofa below you. It isn’t moving. You try to look at yourself but you almost can’t. It’s like your partially see-through. Like a ghost. Are you a ghost??

This is weird. It’s too weird. You keep moving up but don’t know how to stop. The ceiling’s getting closer. You put your hands up to stop yourself but they just go straight through it. Your attention turns back to the scene below you. Maybe it’s a weird dream. Like a lucid dream. If it is a dream you can control what happens. You’re too panicked to just ‘control’ it though. You don’t feel in ‘control’.

You frantically reach down towards yourself. You’re terrified as you keep getting further and further away, and then you rush downward. You throw your hands down, desperately trying to stop. You miss your body and manage to bring yourself to a halt just above Jasper.

You take a moment to breathe a sigh of relief but a moment is all you get. You look down and see one of your hands Ilyas gone through Jasper’s back. It’s inside him. It just passed through as if Jasper wasn’t there. You freak out and pull your hand away but something comes out with it. Something big. A ghost, like you, but not you. Your mouth drops. That ghost looks like Jasper. It IS Jasper. You feel your head start to spin, if you still have a head.

Without thinking, you freak out again and throw Jasper’s ghost just to get it off your hand. The throw sends you actually spinning this time. The momentum
Sends you downwards and you watch as Jasper’s ghost hits your body and disappears right before you body starts to move again. That’s all you see before you hit Jasper’s body back first and everything goes black.

Sensation comes flooding back to you all at once. You can feel the ground below you, hear sounds around you and smell scents around you. Something’s off though. You try to groan but all you hear is a whimper. You try to rub your head but then you see your hand. It’s a paw! You yelp as you jump up. Four legs catch you and you’re stunned into silence. Brown fur covers your two front legs and all of the colours around you look off.

Uneasily, you try to walk slowly to the other side of the room. There’s a full body mirror that your housemate left in the living room. You step in front of it and almost fall over. It’s like you already knew but couldn’t believe it. Jasper is looking back at you. He copies every nod, every tail wag, every movement. You turn away from the mirror and are caught by an even bigger shock. Your body is still on the sofa. It’s still asleep, but it’s moving. It’s breathing and it’s head is moving back and forth. All things it wasn’t doing when you were a ghost and before Jasper hit it. Is that Jasper??

Your shock comes out as a couple of barks. This can’t be real, this can’t be real. You think to yourself over and over again as you walk in circles on all fours.

A thought hits you. It’s a hopefully thought, but an idea all the same. You left your body before. Maybe you can do it again? You try to sit down in Jasper’s body, which takes you a few goes, and focus. You hear a light thud and look down. You’re floating again and you can see Jasper’s body slumped on the ground below you. Your arms and the rest of you are all see-through again. You’ve done it! Well, you’ve almost done it.

“Okay, let’s get this right,” you mutter to yourself, not sure if anyone could hear you right now.

You manage to float slowly towards your body. A small sense of pride washes over you as you feel more in control. You reach your body and waste no time. Your hand plunged into your body and pulls Jasper’s ghost out. Even his ghost is sleeping. You throw his ghost at his body and the one disappears into the other almost as soon as it hits.

“Alright, here we go,” you mumble, psyching yourself up as you push your way back into your body.

Air returns to your lungs and you lurch forward. You look down and pat yourself all over. It’s looks and feels like you. You jump up front he sofa and step over a new snoring Jasper and look in the mirror. Your own face is looking back, copying every move you make. You’ve done it.

Your mind is buzzing. So much has happened. There’s no way it can be real. But you’re tired. You can’t bring yourself to do any more thinking on it. You drag yourself upstairs and all but collapse on your bed. Until tomorrow...

Shouting from downstairs drags you kicking and screaming out of sleep. You push up from the pillow that must‘ve been cushioning your face all night. You hear your name being called by your housemate. By the way, who are you?

1) Jamie Oxford - 19 year old guy in his first year of university. You live with your housemate Dan and, as you’ve met, your dog Jasper. You’re also single.

2) Melanie “Mels” Turner - 19 year old girl on her first year of university. You live with your housemate Becky and, as you’ve met, your dog Jasper. You’re also single.
1.title: Curiosity Killed

11.content:
You push yourself up from and out of your bed. You don’t feel ready to face the day. You’re not even sure what day it is. Dan is still calling your name and figure you should see what he wants. You drag yourself across the room and poke your head through the door.

“Yeah?” you call to him.

“I’m headed out mate. I’ve got a lecture and I’m running late. D’you mind grabbing some toilet roll if you get a chance?”

“Yeah, that’s fine,” you say as you trudge to edge of your bed and fall back onto it.

You go to rub your head. You stop and sit up. That reminded you of something. What’s that french phrase? Whatever. You look down at your hand. It’s your normal hand and arm. Nothing off or weird about it at all. But was last night weird. You cast your mind back. You and Tony caused a ruckus in the university’s underground lab. That happened. Then you came home. That happened. What happened afterwards though? You must’ve just gone straight to bed. It makes sense to you. You are still in your clothes from last night.

You think a bit harder and remember the weirder bits of last night. The device, the part where you were a ghost, AND the part where you were Jasper. These hit you. You were a ghost... and then you were your dog. But no. It was a weird dream.

You laugh it off to yourself and head downstairs to grab some breakfast. As you head down, you pull your phone out of your pocket and go to give Tony a call. You cut across the living room but something stops you before you can hit dial. Nothing was in your way. You thought you saw something. You look over. Jasper. He’s still asleep, no surprise. But you swear he’s in the exact same place and position that he was last night... when you left his body and put him back in it.

But no, it was just a dream... but this is a weird coincidence. What if it wasn’t. You look
At your phone, then back to Jasper...
11.title: Weird Night

111.content:
You shake it off and turn back to your phone. If this is real then being your dog isn’t the way to go. You hit the dial button and put the phone to your ear.

“Yo, what’s up?” you hear Tony at the other end.

Before you can say anything you realise how weird a conversation this could be. What do you say? You didn’t plan this far ahead.

“Hey Tony,” you start uneasily.

He sounds like he can sense the weirdness in your tone. You didn’t hide it all that well.

“Everything alright, Jamie? You sound weird.”

You look over at Jasper and then at your hand.

“Tony. After last night did you see anything... weird?” you finally ask.

“Weird? Like what?”

“I dunno. Like, something out of the ordinary?”

Tony goes quiet for a moment.

“You sure you’re alright,” he asks you.

You feel like you’re just tiptoeing around the subject and it’s getting frustrated.

“Okay. So something weird happened after I got home last night. I don’t really know how to describe it. Can I come over and show you?”

Tony doesn’t say anything for a moment. You can’t help but really feel the weirdness of this conversation.

“Yeah, sure, I guess. It’ll have to be quick though. I’ve got a lecture in an hour”

“I’ll be over in 10.” you say before hanging up.

You run upstairs and grab a couple of bits before rushing back downstairs to the door. As you reach the door you look back into the living room and see Jasper still asleep. You could have one more try as him... no. You’re in a rush. Forget it. You head out, hop on your bike, and cycle over to Tony’s.



10 minutes later you arrive and are let in.

“So what’s this thing you need to show me?” Tony asks. He doesn’t sound impressed or interested.

“Okay, so last night we were in the underground labs, right?” you ask.

“Yeah?” Tony’s tone makes you feel a bit stupid.

“That weird device that got stuck to me... I think it did something to me,” you say hesitantly.

“What do you mean ‘did something’? Tony sounds more curious now.

“Are your housemates here?”

“Not as far as I know? Wait, why?”

You walk into his living room and take a seat on his sofa.

“Jamie,” he starts again, “if this is about a rash or a lump I did not sign up for this.”

“No no. Sit down.”

Tony looks confused and weirded out. His face tells you that he isn’t sure of what to do or say.

“Just trust me,” you tell him.

Slowly and uncomfortably he takes a seat on one of chairs.

“Okay,” you begin, “I don’t think you’ll believe me if I tell you so I’ll just show you.”

“Show me what?” he asks.

You start to concentrate and quickly feel that familiar feeling from last night. The one you weren’t sure you actually experienced where you felt weightless. You look down and see your own body unconscious on the sofa and getting further away as you rise up. You stop yourself from rising with more ease than last time and turn to face Tony.

“Jamie? What’s going on?” Tony asks, looking at your body but not at you.

“Tony! Look up here,” you call, but he doesn’t respond. It’s like he can’t hear you. Ohhh, what if he can’t see or hear you.

“Jamie? Is this what you wanted to show me?”

You realise you need to take a different approach. You float down to Tony’s chair and reach your hand into him like you had done with Jasper.

“Woah, what’s that?” Tony asks just as you pull his ghost out.

He looks right at you and loses all words. His eyes go wide and his mouth hangs open.

“Tony, don’t freak out,” you say, staying calm.

“Why can I see through you?” he almost shouts.

“It’s not just me,” you say back.

Tony looks down at himself and freak out again.

“Why can I see through me??” he’s not getting any calmer.

“Just listen to me,” you say.

“Are we dead???” Tony yells.

You try push your face into your hands but they just kind of go through your face.

“Okay, Tony. Shut up and listen. You’re not dead. I’m not dead. We’re not dead. This is the weird thing I was trying to tell you about.”

“Well you’re right, Jamie. This is weird.” he hits out. He’s not doing much better.

It settles in that words aren’t going to calm him. You need action. No action is going to hit as hard as, well, a drastic one.

“Okay, Tony, this is the only way you’ll listen to me,” you say.

Before Tony can get a word in to question you you turn around and push him into your body. His ghost disappears into your former form which almost immediately comes to life. You watch your eyes flick open as your body jumps up and starts looking around.

“Jamie? Jamie?” Tony (in your body) starts asking, panic clearly setting in.

You float down into Tony’s body. The first thing you notice is the the feeling of the chair against your new form.

“Why am I looking at myself?” you hear your old voice shout. Tony isn’t taking this well.

You stand, feeling off balance for a moment in Tony’s body but getting the hang of it pretty quickly.

“Tony, it’s me,” you say, feeling surprised at hearing Tony’s voice.

“What?” he asks, clearly still freaked out by not hearing his own voice.

“It’s me, Jamie. This is the thing I wanted to show you. I don’t know how, that thing in the lab made me able to hop around different bodies,” you tell him.

Tony’s breathing calms down a bit as he starts to look over your body, his current one.


After a few minutes of explaining, Tony finally gets to a place where he’s ready to talk completely calmly about this.

“So, you can do this at will? Like, whenever you want?” Tony asks with your voice whilst patting his new arms.

“I’m pretty sure,” you say. You’re not actually all that sure now that you think about it, “I guess I’ve only really been you and Jasper.”

“That’s nuts that you were your own dog last night.”

“You have no idea,” you say.

Tony stops and looks over at you. You recognise the look he’s giving you with your own face.

“Jamie, switch us back. I need to get to my lecture. But afterwards we need to meet up and test this out,” he says.

“Why wait until after the lecture?” you ask.

“Because I can’t afford to miss any more of them?” he comes back.

“No no. Why don’t we test it out at your lecture?” you clarify.

Tony gives you a smile and says...
111.title: Who You Gonna Call?

choices: Perry Johnson, from the board game club
Alice Cortez, one of the cheerleaders
1111.content:
“Alright, let’s go to the lecture,” Tony says.

That’s all the agreement you need as you leave Tony’s body and pull him out of yours. As you go to push his ‘ghost’ back into his own body he stops you.

“Hang on,” he says.

“What’s going on?”

“I’m already running late and you’re not in my class. We can’t go as ourselves,” he says.

You take a moment to think about it and agree.

“What do you suggest?” you ask.

“Let’s just fly over there and find some bodies to try,” he says.

You don’t need to be told twice as you start to float out of Tony’s house.

“Oh, urm, Jamie?” you hear Tony call after you.

“Yeah?” you look back.

“How do I fly this thing?”

You almost laugh to yourself. “You mean your ghost?”

“Yeah.”

“You’ll just get used to eventually. It’s how I learned, you finish as you turn and start to float out again.



It doesn’t take too long for the pair of you to reach the computer science department building of the university.

“Okay, so now what?” you ask.

Tony’s eyes watch the people below keenly.

“That’s my class,” he tells you.

“Alright,” you say looking down at them and then back at him, “I guess let’s pick some people.”

“There,” Tony says before diving down into the crowd without warning.

You think you saw which person he dove into. It was a dark-haired guy. You don’t have time to pick a person. You need to stay close to Tony or you might not be able to get him back. The pressure gets to you and you dive into the crowd as close to the person you think Tony is as possible. All of a sudden you feel the world around you again. Your back on solid ground, breathing air, and you can feel the nudges of all the people around you moving in the same direction.

Up ahead you the guy that you think is Tony. No time to work out who you are just yet. You push your way through the crowd until you reach him. You pay him on the shoulder a few times. He turns and looks at you but doesn’t say anything.

“Tony?” you ask. This voice definitely isn’t yours.

His eyes go wide and he pulls you into one of the side corridors as soon as you get into the building.

“Jamie, is that you?” he asks.

“I think so,” you say, “who are you?”

“You mean my body?” he steps back and flexes his new arm muscles, “Trevor Bailey. A gym guy and rower who killed the idea that computer science is just full of lanky, beer-bellies geeks.”

“Only you’re a lanky beer-bellied geek,” you start. “Wait, who am I?” you ask him.

“Oh yeah, about that. You’re...”
1111.title: Distance Learning

1112.content:
“Let’s stick to doing something after the lecture. I can’t afford to miss this one or be distracted during it,” Tony says as he starts collecting up his things.

The two of you head out of the door and you watch him grab his bike and cycle away to the university. You’re left outside his house wishing that that had gone a different way and wondering what to do in the meantime. You take your bike and start to ride it back to your place.

The ride home gives you some time to think on what to do for the next few hours before you meet up with Tony. You take your bike into the house and park it in the back garden. Coming back into the house, you walk into the living room only for Jasper to rush at you seeking attention. You rub his head and remind him of what a good boy he’s been.

“Who’s a good boy? You. You’re such a good boy. Hey,” you pause, thinking about last night, “thanks for letting me be you last night pal.”

This sparks a thought. An idea of what to do. At least, a couple of ideas on what to do. Jasper’s awake now. What if you swapped with him now and let him actually try being human while you get to grips with being a dog?
Or, you did agree to meet up with Tony after his lecture, but you never said who you would be. You could float yourself over to the uni and meet up with him as someone else?
You could also just wait out the next few hours and meet Tony as you.

All of these thoughts course through your mind as you give Jasper the attention he craves until you decide to...
1112.title: To Your Own Devices

11122.content:
You leave Jasper be and tell him that you’ll be back soon. You run upstairs to your room and throw yourself down on your bed.

“Alright, you’ll be safe and out of the way here,” you say to your own body as you pull your ghost out and start to float away.

You pass through your bedroom door, through the walls, and then you’re outside and getting further and further away from your house. As you get the hang of it you start building the courage and go gradually quicker and quicker. Nothing too crazy though.

It doesn’t take long for the university to come into view and you hover above it for a moment.

“Tony won’t be out for a few hours,” you say to yourself, “whoever I pick will have to keep me busy for a while.”

You look at all of the different places across the campus. The science block and library don’t interest you. Neither do the English, history or geography buildings.

After a few minutes of floating around you narrow it down to two choices. The cafe courtyard has outdoor seating. You saw a few people out there who could be fun to be. Alternatively, there’s the gym. You were never that strong or that fast, not that there’s anything wrong with that. That level of fitness was just never for you. It could be fun to see what it’s like though. And imagine the look on Tony’s face if you went to meet him and just immediately picked him up.

That’s it, decision made. You’re going to the gym. You float down, being careful not to make contact with anyone on the way. You’d never been inside the uni gym before so you figured that going through the front door as if you weren’t a ghost is the best way forward. You ignore the reception desk, half expecting them to spot and stop you, and look for some form of directions. You spot them just beyond pointing towards the gym, the pool, and the track.

It doesn’t take long for you to decide that the gym is the place to go. You follow the corridors and staircases as per the signs, almost bumping into a member of staff and a someone else who were both headed in the other direction until you find what you were looking for. A large, open room with rows and rows of treadmills, bike machines and other cardio equipment at one side. Free weights dominate the other side of the room whilst weight machines cover the space in between.

There aren’t too many people around but a couple of them do catch your eye. Over in the weight section you see a large well-built man part let go of the pull up bar to take a quick break. He walks over to the water fountain to take a drink. On the other side of the room you a toned woman come out of the changing rooms and head for one of the treadmills. You recognise her. She’s not a stranger to you like the other man is. Well, not as much of a stranger. You think her name’s Ellie. She’s in some of your lectures and has definitely caught your eye more than once.

You take one last look around the room but already know that these two are your options. You look between the two and quickly make up your mind as you start to float towards...
11122.title: Be someone else

111222.content:
You float over all of the weight and cardio machines between you and Ellie until you were right beside her. Your mind races. Yesterday none of this would have seemed possible. 24 hours later and you’ve been a dog, another man, and, in a few moments, a woman as well. Ellie climbs onto the treadmill and starts to press at the buttons. You need to do it now or your first experience as Ellie will be your balance on a treadmill. Taking a deep breath, or the ghost equivalent, you push forward and into Ellie.

All of the feelings that you’ve been slowly getting used to rush at you all at once. You can suddenly breathe again, you can feel the ground beneath your feet and you’re no longer see through. This is different though. There’s a weight on your chest that forces you to lean forward, and you have to work hard to stand straight. You look down at your new chest and see the slightest bit of Ellie’s cleavage through her sports bra. Your new hands race up to your chest. That’s when you notice them. Far more slender than you’re used to. Her arms are thinner than yours, and even than Tony’s. You don’t think you can compare Jasper’s. There’s a wristband with a numbered a key hanging there. It must be her locker number. Your hands run below your chest to your midsection. It’s all smooth and slim right up until your new hands meet your new abs. You’ve never had those before. They’re not huge, but they’re there.

You get so caught up in exploring your new body that you almost forget where you are. You have a quick glance around the room. No one’s been watching you. There still aren’t all that many people there. The guy you noticed before is still over in the corner, and there’s only 3 or 4 others in the room. You turn back to your new body.

“Maybe I’ll borrow you in lectures every now and then,” you say to yourself, getting a kick out of hearing Ellie’s soft voice say the words.

You’ve still got a lot of time to kill before Tony’s out of his lecture. You look to the treadmill and start fiddling with the controls. After a couple of minutes of not knowing what you’re doing you manage to get it started. The machine starts off at a crawl, so slow that you actually struggle to walk. Part of that struggle is also you not being familiar with a woman’s body, though. You increase the speed to more of a normal walking pace and go from there. The feeling of your new breasts bouncing with every step throws you a bit at first. It’s both distracting and tips your balance, but you get used to it.

“Okay,” you say to yourself as you prepare to speed it up again, “let’s take this slow so I can figure out what you can do.”

20 minutes later you’ve covered 5km, according to the treadmill’s display, and feel like you could go on forever. You gradually slow down the treadmill to a stop and climb off of it. That felt amazing though! You completely love the feeling.

“So that’s what being fit feels like,” you hug yourself.

You look around the room at the other machines and wonder what else you could try out...



Half an hour later, you climb out of your last weight machine. You feel like you’ve had such a good workout, something you’ve never felt before.

“Maybe I should take up running,” you say to yourself with glee.

You head out of the room. As you leave you spot a a man sat at bench watching you go. You don’t know Or recognise him but your body reacts to the sight of him. You’re not sure what to do and, without really thinking, you wink at him as you walk out the door.

“That was weird. That was weird. That was weird,” you say to yourself over and over as you head towards the changing rooms.

You walk in, hoping Ellie’s locker won’t be hard to find, and come face to face with a man stood naked in the middle of the room. You stop dead in your tracks and your eyes shoot straight down as you remember whose body you’re in and realise that you’re in the men’s room. The man spots you and doesn’t attempt to cover up. He shoots you a wink which almost makes you throw up as you turn on your heels and leave as quickly as you can.

Hoping that no one saw you go into the wrong changing room, you head into women’s changing rooms this time. You just want to get out of the gym and wish that Ellie’s locker wouldn’t be difficult to find. As luck would have it, it isn’t. You pull out her things, throw a shirt on over her sports bra, and leave.

As you pass by the gym reception you pull her phone out.

“21 messages and 2 missed calls in the last hour? How are you people so popular,” you ask yourself.

The screen on her phone changes suddenly. The notifications disappear and are replaced with text that reads ‘facial recognitions’ a second or two later the text turns green and her phone unlocks.

“That was easy. And lucky,” you say to yourself, seriously thinking that you might revisit Ellie’s body.

A thought crosses your mind. You want something to remember this by. You open up the camera app, try to pull the hottest face you can, and snap a picture. With a smile you send the picture to your own phone with the caption ‘hey hot stuff’, and then delete the picture and message from Ellie’s phone so that she’ll be none the wiser.


You walk over to the computer science building to meet Tony, loving the feeling of having everyone you pass watch you with either lust or envy. They all either want to be Ellie or sleep with Ellie. But you’re Ellie, so they all either want to be your or sleep with you. You can’t help but grin and feel powerful.

As you reach the computer science building you see masses of students filing out. You’ve made it just in time. You hang hang back and keep an eye out for Tony. He ends up being one of the last to come out. He steps foot outside of the building and stops to look around. After a few moments he pulls out his phone and starts typing away. Tony stands around for a few more minutes, periodically checking his phone, before walking away. You follow at a safe distance behind... this could be fun.

You follow Tony to one of the courtyard cafes. He goes inside and comes out a few minutes later with a drink in hand. When he grabs a seat an empty outdoor table you decide to make your move. He’s still looking around and is caught off guard when you approach him.

“Hi,” you say sweetly, “is that seat taken?”

Tony looks taken aback, “um, no. You can have it.”

“Thanks,” you beam a smile as you join him at the table.

“Oh, you wanted to sit here?” he asks.

“Where else would I want to sit?” you tease.

Tony looks across at another table before turning back to face you.

“I’m sorry,” he starts unconfidently, “I’m waiting for a friend.”

“Well,” you look down at the table, “could I be the friend you’re looking for?”

“I don’t...” he starts but trails off.

You extend your hand out to him, “hi. I’m Ellie.”

He takes it hesitantly and shakes, “Tony.”

“Dude, you’re so bad at this,” you break.

“Huh?”

“Mate, it’s me.”

“What?”

“It’s me,” you thrust your hands towards yourself, “It’s Jamie.”

Tony’s mouth drops and you worry that his jaw’ unhinged.

“Are you - are you serious?”

You roll your eyes at him, “do I need to prove it?”

“Yes please,” he replies, both quicker than your expected and quicker than you’re comfortable with.

He pushes himself up to standing, clearly still uneasy being on two human legs, and walks to mirror on the other side of the living room. You follow him over and stand side by side. You can’t help but think how weird this is. Anyone looking in at this wouldn’t think it was odd. Just a dog and it’s owner standing next to each other. Those people would have no idea that the two are in each other’s bodies though.

“This is,” Jasper says slowly, raising his new hands up to his new face, “so cool! I mean, I’m human. I don’t understand.”

You yap excitedly up at him.

“I can’t believe that you would do this. That you would want to be me,” Jasper says, beaming down me of your smiles at you.

You yap again at him.

“I think you’re right,” he says as he kneels down in front of you, “this is going to be fun.”

Jasper puts his hand on your head and starts stroking. You go weak and fall over with enjoyment. He works his hands down to your belly and starts scratching and rubbing. You cheerfully yap again and again as your tongue hangs loose.

“Who’s a good boy?” he starts to ask.

This is why dogs love it so much.

Jasper stops sooner than you would have liked and slumps onto the sofa, looking again at his new hands.

“I can’t believe this. This is so cool!” he says again as you climb back to your feet.

“I need to do something. I want to know what being human is like,” he says aloud. You’re not sure if he’s talking to you or himself.

“I know,” he throws your arms up...
12221.title: Doggy Doggy What Now?

123.content:
You swipe your arms at Becky, trying to push her away. Your attempts are futile as your arms pass straight through her.

“No! Becky, stop!” you shout.

Becky’s body falls to the floor in front of you. Just like with your body, she’s unconscious.

“Becks?” you ask, floating over Becky’s body.

“What’s going on?” you hear Becky’s voice from above.

You look up and there she is. Floating above you as a ghost. Becky is looking at her see-through arms that have passed through your bedroom ceiling and is freaking out.

“Becky!” you call, but she doesn’t hear you over her own fear.

“Becky!” you try again. Still nothing.

“Becky!” one more time. The loudest of the three. She stops and turns towards you.

“Mels?” she stumbles, her voice quivers.

“Becks, it’s okay,” you say.

She looks at her arms at waves them through your bedroom ceiling and wall.

“Are we dead?” she asks.

“No. We’re not. I don’t really know how to explain it,” you say.

“How do you know we’re not dead?”

You look down at both of your unconscious bodies.

“Because I did this,” you say, “it was an accident, but I did this. I know how to fix it, though.”

Becky gives you a confused and not very well coordinated look.

“What do you mean you did this?” she asks.

“Something weird happened last night,” you say, not feeling totally sure on whether to share this or not, “I got home afterwards and this happened.”

“You’ve been like this since last night?” Becky sounds as though she’s starting to freak out again.

“No no. Whatever happened last night made me able to leave my body as, well, I guess as a ghost. I got back into my body. I don’t have full control over it yet though and I accidentally knocked you out of your body.”

“Okay,” Becky follows slowly, “so I can just get back into my body?”

“Yeah. You could even get into my body if you wanted,” you tell her.

Becky’s eyes go wide.

“That’s a thing we could do?” she asks.

“Yeah. I found out last night... when I accidentally ended up in Jasper’s body.”

Becky floats silently for a moment.

“You mean to tell me that...” she starts.

“Yeah,” you try to scratch the back of your head, forgetting that it’s not solid right now, “sorry I woke you up in the night with all my barking. I was suddenly our dog. Can you blame me?”

Becky looks between you and your bodies below for a few moments.

“So I could go into your body?” she asks.

“Yeah, you could,” you say back.

“And I would be you?”

“You would.”

Becky pulls a face as if she’s concentrating really hard and then begins to slowly float downwards. She ignores her body on the floor and aims for your body laid out on the bed. You watch as she gets closer and closer and then disappears into your body. Almost instantly your body shoots and and takes a deep breath through its nose. Your hands rush up and start patting your body from the head downwards.

“This can’t be real,” your body says before covering its mouth in shock.

You float down towards Becky’s body and jump in. All of the sensations of life immediately come rushing back to you. You feel like you can smell and feel like a normal person again. You push yourself up into a seated position and look over your new body. Becky’s tanned and manicured hands, her longer hair. Both Becky’s chest and general frame are little larger than yours. They might take some getting used to.

Becky has climbed off of the bed and is watching her new reflection in the mirror.

“This is crazy,” she almost shouts, turning to face you as you cup your new chest.

“Tell me about it,” you say back.

“We’ve got to do something with this,” Becky announces.

“You mean something other than what we’re doing right now?” you say.

“No, but like. I don’t know. We could go shopping for each other or... or we could out and meet some guys tonight like this,” she replies.

You give her a quizzical look.

“Don’t you have a boyfriend?” you ask her.

“Well,” she stops looking in the mirror and puts her full attention on you, “I’m in your body so I’m technically you. Therefore I don’t have a boyfriend and it won’t be cheating.”

“What about me? I’m in your body so I technically do have a boyfriend.”

“But Mels,” she starts, “you’re not really me and you’re not actually dating Caleb. You have my blessing to do whatever if we go out tonight.”

Becky turns back towards the mirror and watches her new face as she contemplates.

“Okay,” she finally says, “let’s...”
123.title: Through Your Eyes

1232.content:
“Let’s go out tonight!” Becky says. It’s so strange seeing Becky’s mannerisms and hearing her tone come from your face and your voice.

“Alright, yeah, let’s do it,” you say, “but if your boyfriend calls me I’m not dealing with him.”

“It’ll all be fine,” she says back.

Becky inspects the mirror closely, precisely dabbing parts of her new face and pulling faces.

“What are you doing, Becks?” you ask her as you push yourself up from the floor.

“I’m just trying to get my head around being you,” she replies.

Becky stands up straight and puts her hand out towards the mirror as though she expected it to shake her hand.

“Hi, I’m Melanie Turner, but my friends call me Mels,” she says to the mirror, trying to make herself sound cute.

“Alright well, if you need me I’ll be in my new room,” you say as you head out and go across to Becky’s bedroom.

To be fair, you figure it is kind of your bedroom now. Only technically. You throw yourself down on Becky’s bed and stretch across it.

“I’m Becky,” you say aloud to yourself, still feeling a bit weirded out by the sound of your housemate’s voice leaving your lips.

“I’m Becky,” you say again.

“Caleb’s my boyfriend. I’m Becky. I live with Melanie. Man this is weird.”

You get up and walk over to the mirror by her desk. You haven’t actually looked at yourself since you and Becky swapped. You haven’t actually been another human other than yourself and Becky. Your dog Jasper is the only other one you’ve swapped with. First thing you did with him was look in the mirror. Becky has a pretty face but not a bitchy one. You’ve thought it ever since you first met. Although you never thought you’d one day be wearing her face. Strands of her long brown hair keep falling in front of your face and blocking the view. You’re actually really enjoying seeing her look back at you in the mirror. Not that you don’t like yourself.

You cast your mind to tonight. There’s so much more to figure out. Where are you gonna go? When’re you gonna go? Are you swapping back at any point before tonight? Are you going to get your old body ready and then swap or just get your new body ready? You can work it all with Becky. For now though, you need to get used to seeing someone else’s face in the mirror.



The day flies by. You hardly notice and morning turns into noon and then evening. You’d spent the day getting used to being in each other’s bodies, going for a few walks trying on outfits for tonight and trying to make Becky look even better than she already did.

You say in Becky’s bedroom, technically yours at the moment, putting the finishing touches to your makeup. The bedroom door flew open and you turned to see Becky dance into room in your body. She was already ready and had made your body look HOT. You couldn’t string a sentence together as you made a mental note to take makeup tips for Becky in future.

“Alright,” Becky started as she handed you a cup without telling you what the drink inside was, “the taxi’s taking us to Basemnt in like 5 minutes so we’ve gotta drink up.”

You can’t help but smile as you take your first sip from the cup. It was just beer.

“Mate, you made my body look so hot!” you tell Becky.

She grins from ear to ear and gives you a twirl of your own body. The dress, the face, the hair. You can help but think that your body looks perfect. What guy won’t be hitting on your friend in your body tonight?

The pair of you get the rest of the drinks down you just in time for the taxi to arrive. You jump in and, in no time at all, you’re outside Basemnt. The queue outside is long. Too long you think. Maybe you should try somewhere else. Becky doesn’t share your concern. She strides over to the bouncer, followed by you, and doesn’t even need to turn on the charm before the guy lets both of you in ahead of the queue.

You get inside and can hardly hear yourself think. Despite that, you can’t help but be excited for tonight. The music’s booming, the vibe is buzzing, the people are packed in, the night is young, and you’re in the body of your hot friend, even if she made your body look even hotter.

The pair of you push your way to one of the bars and buy your first round of drinks. The night has officially started. You drink. You dance. You laugh. You take pictures. At one point you lose Becky for a few minutes but don’t think anything of it. It doesn’t take long to find her, but when you do you see that she’s chatting with a guy. He’s a cute guy as well. You smile for your friend and leave her to her fun.

Back at the bar you’re ordering again. It might be your 5th of the night, it might be your 8th. You can’t remember how many. Becky’s tolerance is so much better than yours though. As you’re getting ready to pay this guy appears next to you. He shoots you a smile that almost makes you melt inside before turning to the bartender.

“Make it two of whatever she’s ordered. It’s on me,” he shouts.

As is focus is on the bartender you look him up and down. His dress sense is excellent. His hair is impeccable. Arms? Just right. And he’s buying this round.

You look back over to the crowd but can’t see any sign of Becky or her mystery man anymore. The sound of two bottles clinking next to you at the bar draws your attention back.

“So what do I call you?” the man shouts in your ear to be heard over the music.

You’re about to tell him that you’re name is Melanie when you look down and remember that things have changed.

“I’m Becky,” you tell him, feeling giddy about having finally said it to another person.

“Sebastian,” he replies as you take a swig of your drink.

“Well, thanks for the drink, Sebastian,” you say.

The night goes on as most nights out do, for the most part. Throughout Basemnt people drank and danced, a couple of people had fights over girls who weren’t even interested and mistaken identities. One guy threw up just outside and a second guy was drunk enough to slide along the sick while sat on a baking tray that he’s brought out with him. But you spent that evening with Sebastian. You’d talked and drank together and, as closing loomed nearer, the pair of you left.

You stood outside and Sebastian hailed a taxi. You turned to him as it pulled in.

“I had a good time tonight,” you say both sweetly and genuinely, “do you, maybe, wanna come back to mine?”

He looks at the taxi and then back at you, “not tonight, but I’d love to see you again. You’ve got my number. Call me.”

You feel a wave of disappointment wash across you, but at the same time, a small feeling of accomplishment.

“Look, your driver’s waiting...” Sebastian starts.

He doesn’t get to finish his sentence when you pull him in unexpectedly and lock lips. The first few seconds he was shocked, but then he kissed back. For a moment you felt such a deep desire to experience all of the passion that you could be having with him tonight but then you break the kiss. He looks pleased, you feel warm inside, and you climb into the taxi and are whisked home.


All is silent back at your house except for the yapping of Jasper as you return later than he’s used to. You’re not sure if Becky’s back yet. You look down at Jasper and give him a quick pet.

“Good boy. Who’s a good boy? Isn’t it funny how I was you this time yesterday?”

You leave Jasper be, head up to Becky’s room, and collapse onto her bed. It’s been a mental day.


You’re woken not long later. Or, a while later. You’re not sure how much longer later. You hear the front door crash open and then be hurriedly locked. Lots of muffled noises and surprisingly loud whispers. But you’d recognise your own voice anywhere. Becky’s just gotten back, and she’s brought someone with her. Part of you wants to go and check it out, but you’re also tired and want to go to bed. You think about it for a moment and...

info.brief_description: What if you had the power to hop between bodies?
info.description:
Enjoy the story and please feel free to add your own chapters. I’m sure I’ll add updates here as we go

Update 1: okay, so I guess this is just a couple of rules/ context.

1) the main character has the power to remove their ‘ghost’ from their body at will.

2) whilst in ‘ghost form’ the main character can fly through walls and ceilings and etc. They can also jump into other people’s bodies, human or animal. The main character’s ‘ghost is the same size and shape as the main character so would really struggle to jump into a really small body, like an ant or fly.

3) when jumping into other bodies the main character can pull the other person/ animal’s ‘ghost’ out first and place it in another body. Alternatively the main character can just jump straight in without pulling the other person’s ghost out. They’ll have no memory of what happens whilst the main character is in control

4) anyone who is in ‘ghost form’ has the same abilities as the main character, but only the main character can leave a body whenever they choose
